Container.Name: tsMuxeR
Container.Overview: tsMuxer is a Transport Stream muxer. Remux/mux elementary streams, EVO/VOB/MPG, MKV/MKA, MP4/MOV, TS, M2TS to TS to M2TS. Supported video codecs H.264, VC-1, MPEG2. Supported audio codecs AAC, AC3 / E-AC3(DD+), DTS/ DTS-HD. Ability to set muxing fps manually and automatically, change level for H.264 streams, shift sound tracks, extract DTS core from DTS-HD, join files. Output/author to compliant Blu-ray Disc or AVCHD. Blu-ray 3D support. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on client side) or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-tsmuxer/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-tsmuxer/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Warning:[/b][/span] Because tsMuxeR is a 32-bit application, unRAID must be at least at version 6.4-rc7 for this container to work.
Container.Description: tsMuxer is a Transport Stream muxer. Remux/mux elementary streams, EVO/VOB/MPG, MKV/MKA, MP4/MOV, TS, M2TS to TS to M2TS. Supported video codecs H.264, VC-1, MPEG2. Supported audio codecs AAC, AC3 / E-AC3(DD+), DTS/ DTS-HD. Ability to set muxing fps manually and automatically, change level for H.264 streams, shift sound tracks, extract DTS core from DTS-HD, join files. Output/author to compliant Blu-ray Disc or AVCHD. Blu-ray 3D support. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on client side) or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-tsmuxer/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-tsmuxer/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Warning:[/b][/span] Because tsMuxeR is a 32-bit application, unRAID must be at least at version 6.4-rc7 for this container to work.
Container.Changes:
[font size=4][center]tsMuxeR Change Log[/center][/font] [font size=3][b]v1.2.2[/b][/font] (2017-10-09) - Now using baseimage v3.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed issue where nginx config change was not applied correctly on systems without IPV6 support and secure connection disabled.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.1[/b][/font] (2017-10-08) - Now using baseimage v3.0.1, which brings the following changes: - Fixed nginx config for systems without IPV6 support.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.0[/b][/font] (2017-10-07) - Now using baseimage v3.0.0, which brings the following changes: - Better support for service dependencies. - Added support for secure access to the application's GUI.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.6[/b][/font] (2017-09-08) - Now using baseimage v2.0.8, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Fixed timezone support on alpine-glibc images. - Fixed duplicated entries in /etc/passwd and /etc/group that were created after a restart of the container.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.5[/b][/font] (2017-08-14) - Now using baseimage v2.0.6, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.20.0.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.4[/b][/font] (2017-07-31) - Now using baseimage v2.0.5, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Clear the environment of the container during startup. - Clear the /tmp folder during startup. - Cleanly terminate the X server when container is restarted/stopped. - Improved robustness of X server starting process. - Removed unneeded files from the image.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.3[/b][/font] (2017-07-27) - Now using baseimage v2.0.3, which brings the following changes: - Improved robustness of the X server starting process.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.2[/b][/font] (2017-07-23) - Now using baseimage v2.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Proper VNC port is exposed.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.1[/b][/font] (2017-07-18) - Now using baseimage v2.0.1, which brings the following changes: - Internal enhancements. - Clean temporary files left by npm.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-17) - Now using baseimage v2.0.0, which brings the following changes: - Various internal enhancements. - Fixed the way a service waits for another one.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-08) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated. This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup. Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes. GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

Config.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
Config.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used.
